intro: Palicourea tumidonodosa, commonly known as the swollen-node palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its distinctive swollen nodes along its stems, which give it its common name. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth surface and a slightly glossy appearance. Palicourea tumidonodosa produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, followed by small, fleshy fruits.
